I figured out how to make it look like someone else edited my posts, so for lulz I did so in a thread about the Magic Boulder, made it look like the SQUAD account was editing my posts to keep the location of the boulder secret. I knew I was skirting the rules when I did it and fully expected a warning or something, but instead I got a 30-point infraction for impersonating Squad staff. The moderator who infracted me was kind enough to write me a very nice PM afterwards explaining why it is not a good idea to do such things even in jest.

Shortly afterwards Rule 3.3 was slightly revised to include the phrase "intended for use of parody", I can't help but feel partly responsible.
How do you guys feel about SQUAD's recent decisions (How they announced ps4 release, post 1.0 updates, etc) and the community's backlash? Please, be honest.

How do you guys feel about SQUAD's recent decisions (How they announced ps4 release, post 1.0 updates, etc) and the community's backlash? Please, be honest.

If you ask me, I am thrilled by the prospect of Unity 5, because I expect it to include PERFORMANCE ENHANCEMENTS! plus, I think it might deal with some of the more annoying, lasting bugs. I did a post here about it.

PS4 : Not so much, although I do look forward to the performance increases that are all but guaranteed by consoles' inferior hardware.

The backlash : a lot of people have been overly negative recently. PS4 does not mean the death if KSP. If Squad b makes a bad decision, cut them some slack. It's their first game, and it's a pretty dang good one for all of its faults. Enjoy what you have, rather than complaining about what you don't
